website_summaries.verdict: The ViewSonic LightStream PJD5155 is a bright data projector, with solid image quality, that can be had for a modest price.
pros: Can project 3D content from Blu-ray players, as well as PCs

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately 0/2
customer_reviews.text: The image is great, menus are intuitive and the brightness is adequate even on eco mode. We purchased the WXGA high-resolution model for my Daughter's mathematics classroom, unfortunately, Viewsonic packaged the lower quality SVGA model in a box labeled with WXGA. Amazon offered a return so we purchased another. The second one was the correct model, but the bulb began to flicker within a few hours of operation. We have arranged to return the second one once the first one is back at Amazon and the refund confirmed. We have already installed the infrastructure for this model and we like the image....but do we try it a third time? Not sure yet.
customer_reviews.author: Wishy Washy

customer_reviews.title: We love it!!
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had our first outdoor movie on it yet but I did try it out on the side of my pole barn...the picture was great and it was huge !! This was a great buy....my kids are very excited and are ready to start our summer movie nights!
customer_reviews.author: Christina meyers

customer_reviews.title: Not a Keeper
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to replace my old viewsonic projectors with this model, and was glad to find that the image was so bright and crisp. But my computer guru realized that the image was rippling across the screen, and then I saw what he was talking about so I returned the projector.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Biggest bang for the buck on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I bought an Epson unit from Best Buy for $299 due to the high praise as a business projector suitable for PPT presentations, except that it stunk! Blurry images, hard to read text and washed out colors. So I shopped around and tried to find the next best deal - and this is IT! For just $30 more I have crystal clear images, sharp text and bright colors. PLUS this one has an audio output for connecting your own speakers (backyard movie night here we come!). I am EXTREMELY pleased with this unit!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T. Drefs

customer_reviews.title: This projector died in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: We've had this projector for 11 months, we've used it probably half a dozen times, and all of a sudden it's not working. You plug it in and the red light flickers and then goes off. We needed it for a very important presentation last week and certainly didn't expect it not to work. Not happy at all!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Michaud

customer_reviews.title: 7 months and it was out
customer_reviews.text: We didn't even use this projector everyday. We had product for 7 months, usage was about twice a week, total of 167 hrs. of usage and now it shuts down after 5 min. of use. Spend a little more on a product that is more durable to avoid complications.
customer_reviews.author: HARRIS L.

customer_reviews.title: Think twice
customer_reviews.text: Our old project is Church died on Monday during our big Vacation Bible School kick off and we didn't know what to do and knew we had a tight budget, however, we came across this and it is simply amazing and the even better news is... It came on Thursday and we were able to end our week with a bang for the community!!! UPDATE!!!! The projector stopped working Aug. 2018. It was a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Tj FIelds

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money. Simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to watch outdoor movies and sports events on a big screen. The picture is great. I plug in a JBL Bluetooth speaker in with a small cable for extended loud sound and off we go. It will accept anything you plug into it (computer, HDMI, blue ray, video games, you name it). Just plug and go. We watched a kids movie in the basement the other night during a strong thunderstorm, the grandkids never knew it was storming. Indoor/Outdoor, this machine will be used a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Captain Roger

customer_reviews.title: Clear picture and good contrast ratio for the price
customer_reviews.text: Clear picture and good contrast ratio for the price! We're using this projector in our basement for movies and games. Blacks and darker colors show up really well and not over-illuminated. My only qualm -- and it's a small one -- is that there's not a good way to reduce the projector's volume. Level 1 of the projector's built-in speaker volume is quite loud, but we'll be getting speakers soon. Otherwise, zero complaints. -- A Note on Zoom -- Be aware that the zoom-in / zoom-out is very limited and your projected image size is determined mostly by distance from the screen, so be sure you read the product details and measure your space.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if you have an important presentation!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Viewsonic because we thought Viewsonic was a very reliable brand. During our work presentation for the clients, it will not recognize my laptop even though I checked the connections and cables carefully. It had worked previously when we were finalizing the presentation at our office. At first I thought it was an issue with my laptop and I tried connecting my laptop to the clients' projector. My laptop works with the clients' projector. Luckily my client had a projector in his office. Wasted almost an hour setting up the presentation. Good thing the clients were very understanding and not in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: Chris swan

customer_reviews.title: A Great Projector For The Price!
customer_reviews.text: If your needing a good projector for power point presentations, this is a good choice. It has a bright lamp and a nice clear picture. It has a 3300 lumen lamp which is pretty good for $300.00 dollars! If your looking for a 1080p projector, you'll need to look elsewhere and pay a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: DLStallings

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Projector for Price
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for a conference and they out performed the projectors provided by the conference center. We used them in a large room for an audience of over 60 people, good, bright, and crisp picture. We are going to be purchasing 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: Megan M. Heil

customer_reviews.title: Almost died in 6 month
customer_reviews.text: I bought the projector ViewSonic PA503W 3600 Lumens just 6 month ago, it was bright at the beginning and now it's blinking and very dim. And I didn't over use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Short bulb life + expensive replacement bulb
customer_reviews.text: It’s decent. It will work for home theater. Not super fancy. However, the bulb will blow far below the 15,000 hours advertised. The replacement bulbs are half the price of a new projector. Less than 8,000 hours on the machine. Planned obsolescence. I feel cheated, taken advantage of. Cheaply made with an expensive price. Buy it, but beware; it won’t last nearly as long as they say it will. Caveat emptor
customer_reviews.author: S. Keen

customer_reviews.title: Unit is light and easy to carry despite the generous footprint
customer_reviews.text: Unit is light and easy to carry despite the generous footprint. I used it to project a PPT in a conference room lit with indoor lighting (fluorescent maybe) and brightness was very good, as was the focus. It would have been nice to have a protective cover for the lens as available on many projectors.
customer_reviews.author: Osnat Lustig

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Projector
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased a lower cost ($175-$185) 3600 lumen projector manufactured by a company unknown to me, but they received good reviews. I had to return that projector since it just wasn't bright enough nor resolution good enough to be effective in non-darkened rooms (business environments). My gut had told me to go with the ViewSonic since they have a very good reputation with computer displays etc. I ordered the ViewSonic PA503X as a replacement although it was about $100 more expensive. What a dramatic difference! Just an impressive bright, sharp display. Great quality and in my mind, worth every cent of the higher price. Don't sort change yourself, this projector is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mini USB does NOT output power....
customer_reviews.text: Despite what Viewsonic says in answered questions on this Amazon page, the mini USB port does NOT output power making usage with the Fire Stick and others way more difficult than it needs to be, vs other projectors that you can just plug it directly back into the projector for power. I don't know why on this page they say that it outputs power when it doesn't! Just a heads up. I bought two different mini USB to regular USB converters, both did not work (despite that the converters themselves have the capability to output power). Really frustrating! This would have been a deciding factor if I had known :/
customer_reviews.author: olive

customer_reviews.title: Brightness trumps resolution
customer_reviews.text: Compared to newer, higher resolution projectors, this one still provides good resolution for well over $100 less than its next competitor. While there is much higher resolution to be had, SVGA is plenty for the PowerPoints I typically use, and it is plenty bright in most rooms. In my opinion, brightness trumps resolution most of the time and I am very pleased with this projector. For the money, I think this is definitely a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Peters

customer_reviews.title: Best mix of performance and value.
customer_reviews.text: With the proliferation of overblown stats and ridiculous performance claims on cheap import projectors it’s easy to be turned off by major brands who don’t seem to deliver the same at higher prices. Most will work just fine for the casual user or person with a blacked out room. In my case this is a backyard projector and I needed to know I’d have real lumens over 3,000 (not lux, which is not the same). I had a decent but aging 1,800 lumens Optima and this thing blows that out of the water in terms of everything. Color saturation, brightness, keystone settings, operation noise, all that. Glad I spent a little more money and got this.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D McClane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Projector!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent projector! Very clear picture, even with small print on Powerpoint. Great quality video with both video clips stored on the computer and streaming video. I haven't tried out a DVD yet, but have no question that it would perform very well. As with any projector, unless you're doing a very small presentation, and even then, I would would used an external powered speaker of some kind.
customer_reviews.author: David N. Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Works for the church
customer_reviews.text: Weekly we rent a teen center auditorium and needed a projection solution that would work with the ambient light. I had three goals: 1) needed to be high enough contrast when lights were on to read, 2) needed to be able to support display that was sharp on a 100” projection screen 3) wanted a brand that I could get support or replacement parts when the bulb burns out, eventually. So far this is doing the trick. We are satisfied with the job it’s doing and are happy we didn’t take the risk on the cheaper offbrands I compared on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: zbeyer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price tag
customer_reviews.text: Not worth $300. The specs look good on paper. I have a $90 projector I was replacing. I was looking forward to the 1080p picture and built in speaker. Unfortunately, the picture is grainy and washed. The settings don’t give many options to adjust the ratio. You will need external speakers because the fan is aggressively loud. Also the lamp light projects out of the vent holes; this projects random lights in a dark room. Like tiger strips around your projector screen.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent projector for the money very good picture quality even in the day time
customer_reviews.author: Monty Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Have used it a few times for business. Excellent brightness and contrast in lighted rooms.....of course it's always nicer in a dark room, any projector would. I can't wait to use it to watch Monday Night Football outside in the fall too! I personally, at least as far as my work presentations go, with video, I can't see any reason to spend quite a bit more on a higher res projector, vids look great on this!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We use this as an overhead projector in our church sanctuary. It works great. The works and pictures are bright and easy to read and see. There are elderly congregants and they commented how much easier it was for them to sing along with worship because they could see the words! It is a smaller sanctuary and has lousy lighting, but this projector makes a world of difference and works great for us!
customer_reviews.author: AmyJean Barclay

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: After 400 hours of using this projector the screen start flickering. Just wasted my $350 so please do yourself a favor and dont buy it.
customer_reviews.author: ~~Mohamed~~

customer_reviews.title: First time not a charm
customer_reviews.text: I give this pro projector a one-star review until I receive my other one. The first one I received yesterday, came on once worked beautifully after installation and then after I turned it off it would never come back on again. I did all trouble shooting steps that I could manage to find online and still nothing. It powers up and then a red light comes on. The power light blinks twice and the machine powers back down. Hopefully the new one I have coming will work properly because the picture was beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Hollins

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used this projector to make a slide presentation to about 100 people in a school auditorium. It took me less than an hour to set it up to work with my Surface notebook. I also set it up to work with my Lenovo laptop, just in case I had any problems with the Surface. The two computers had different video input ports but this posed no problem. The projector has intuitive controls and worked easily with a Bluetooth pointer/mouse. The projector is very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing purchase I ordered it on Saturday and it arrived on Monday. I opened it up like a little kid and started messing with it and told the family to blow up the projector screen in the back yard, I hooked it up with my blu ray player and an external speaker and watched return of the jedi. What a great picture for the price. Considering I had another name brand projector that cost way more with the same picture. But I like the price of this one a whole lot better. The bulb went out on my other one. If looking for a cheap back yard projector this would be it. Happy customer I am.
customer_reviews.author: Awesome Dad

customer_reviews.title: Good for lighted areas
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after much research. I needed a projector for bible lessons in a well lit basement of our church. I was worried the class would not be able to see anything on the screen. With this one, with the screen directly under a ceiling light, was clear as a bell. I was very satisfied. It starts easily, is easy to run, connects fast, simple. I highly recommend this for school, class, lecture uses. Do not know how it does with movies.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Really worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: I tried and returned cheaper, well reviewed projectors. I show a lot of images and video in my presentations and the cheaper projector was blurry and dim. If you want people to be able to read text and see image details and to use the projector where it isn't very dark, you want to spend more for this one. Bright enough to brighter rooms, simple to use. There really is a huge difference between the $80-100 projectors and the $225+ projectors. Get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Swanky Glazner

customer_reviews.title: Missing Power Chord, Bulb has 23 hours logged, BOUGHT NEW
customer_reviews.text: This projector works great, no complaints about the product itself, however the box it arrived in had obviously been repurposed, had old labels that had been ripped off etc. Upon opening there was no power chord included. We had an extra chord lying around so were able to use the projector which like stated above works great. After checking the Lamp details on the projector menu it had 23 hours of use logged, so obviously the projector was in used condition. I bought it new and was sent a used projector. I would love to be compensated with power chord and new bulb. Be warned of trickery.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Forgione

customer_reviews.title: quality projector
customer_reviews.text: With so many cheap projectors on the market, it's tough to decide what to get, so we opted for a known brand that we have had positive experiences with. We got this so we could have movie nights outside. The picture quality is great, and the projection angle is such that it should sit on the ground as it projects upwards. It worked on our 120" screen from a distance of about 12' away. The speaker are basically useless, so we hooked up a set of computer speakers with a subwoofer, and it worked great. Just a warning, it needs to be fully dark to show movies outside.
customer_reviews.author: J. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Shuts off after 30 seconds, replacement has the same issue.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as an upgrade from my little Apeman projector. Used, like new product. This is bright enough to view in a lit room, the colors and contrast are great. Worth the price. Update - after one month the projector won’t stay on for more than a few seconds. Contacted viewSonic who told me I was responsible for shipping back to them. Beware, they sell you a turd and then make you pay more to return their mistake. Another update - After one months the replacement has the same issue. It shuts off after 30 seconds. I wish I could give this zero stars
customer_reviews.author: Steven Beals

customer_reviews.title: This is way worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this twice. The first time, I returned it. I'm a frugal person and it was an impulse buy. I decided to return it because we have friends who have them. I had a small cheap projector that does ok. Now that we're home ALL THE TIME, I decided to commit. This thing is as powerful as the projector in my elementary classroom. It works during the day on our back porch. It's easy enough to set up that I can move it into a bedroom or whatever and cast it on the wall. I have an outdoor portable projector screen that I use for outdoor moving nights, too. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Had too many issues with it: 1) I could ...
customer_reviews.text: Had too many issues with it: 1) I could never get the picture to display squarely on the screen. When I get the left side squared, the right side becomes unsquared and vice versa. The projector only had vertical keystone adjustments which didn’t help. I ended up trying to use coasters and folded paper under the projector legs to try to level it which helped a little but since this was going to primarily be stationed on a table, it didn’t look right. The projector should come with more adjustable legs —- it only came with an adjustable front one. 2) No lense cap I returned this and will try the Epson VS250.
customer_reviews.author: no name

customer_reviews.title: Far Exceeds Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I tried out my ViewSonic 3600 Lumens SVGA High Brightness Projector for the first time today and the picture quality is great for PowerPoint presentations and watching training videos. I bought it on sale for $300 and find it a great bargain for the price I paid. Even in a well-lit room, the projection quality is great. I used HDMI cable to connect the device to my laptop. Worked like a charm. The one thing that would make it better would be a remote that would work for transitioning from slide to slide while using PowerPoint. Highly recommend the ViewSonic 3600 Lumens. Projector.
customer_reviews.author: Friendly Bubba

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my old one
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I had an old one from about 4 years ago (not Viewsonic, but was highly rated then). This one is soooo much better. Faster to turn on, brighter, quietier, better at handling modern inputs and outputs, better color, and the screen size can easily be adjusted. My only complaint is that there isn't any good way to level the thing. There's a way to raise and lower the front, but the feet don't adjust, so if your stand isn't level, your picture will be tilted.
customer_reviews.author: DomLazz

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect projector for someone who wants true quality but can't ...
customer_reviews.text: Did A LOT of research. This is the perfect projector for someone who wants true quality but can't break the bank. Highlights: - great image quality (I use it outdoors on my deck at night) - was shocked at how great the sound was ... if I just have another guest watching with me we don't need additional speakers - relatively light weight - attractive design
customer_reviews.author: Samar

customer_reviews.title: Good for watching movies but connect external speakers
customer_reviews.text: Good for watching the movie. Sound quality not good. For Power Point presentations, it is a bit less sharper than to my liking. I am adding a couple of lines after using it for a while. For presentations, the screen is brighter and sharper when I use the VGA connector but if I use the HDMI connector, screen gets a bit less brighter and less sharper. Can't figure this out. My new computer doesn't have the VGA connector, so I have to use the HDMI connection. It's a bit annoying to have the brightness and sharpness less than what I could get out of the projector.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetnut

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This is my second projector. The first turned out to be a toy, so I tried to buy from a brand name for the second one. Very nice picture quality, this one is not HD, but, to be honest, you will hardly see any difference. Can stream from a variety of sources. Is very bright, can use outdoors once it starts to get darker. Among weaknesses is the fact that it gets very hot. Used it for several movie nights and hope to use more. I recommend to purchase a screen for it both for quality and esthetic purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Value seeker

customer_reviews.title: A very solid choice
customer_reviews.text: The projection is easy to see even with ambient light encroaching. If you are contemplating a DLP like this one versus an LCD my experience has been more positive with the DLP. The Viewsonic has no trouble connecting to my computer and so far we have been very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lost Armadillo

customer_reviews.title: Best Value!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This projector is probably the best value if it fits your needs. My screen is about 11 feet wide and 20 feet from the projector mount. So I need a projector with a zoom or throw ratio around 2:1. Most home projectors need to be much closer to the screen for the screen size that I have. My living room also has lots of ambient light, so I need a very bright projector. This one is certainly bright. No problems seeing the picture even in well lit rooms. The colors could be a little better, but I suspect you would have to spend much, much more to get a noticeable improvement.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Phenominal outdoor movie night projector
customer_reviews.text: Bright, high contrast. Not the full high def, but I bought a cheaper projector with better specs to compare, I also bought an expensive HD projector...while the really expensive unit did look nice...it's hard to justify 4x the cost. Bright & high contrast is what you want. The BS cheap imports with 6000 lumens and HD really just look like crap. Projected onto the garage door, side of the house, inflatable screen or rear projection - does a fantastic job.
customer_reviews.author: thebloker

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector IF YOU DON'T NEED Native 1080p
customer_reviews.text: This one is partly my fault; I read the description and it stated it supported 1080p. I didn't realize that meant it could only USE a 1080p signal, not actually display that signal IN 1080p. Overall, if you need a good, solid, bright projector, this is the one. If you need NATIVE 1080p support, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: 1ShoppingWife

customer_reviews.title: outdated
customer_reviews.text: looks and feels like I'm watching a projector from the 1980s. pixels are apparent with the screen door effect. THere's banding in the gradients and motion is not smooth. Also has artifacts in the green and magenta bleeding into everything. I would not recommend this. It's bright though!! can show a picture in full day light if that's an important criteria for you
customer_reviews.author: Minyan Zhu

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to play movies on the patio at night while grandchildren were visiting.We All Loved it! PIcture quality and sound was better than expected.You do have to have a set of speakers to connect to it.Movie selection from Amazon movies was super and my teenage grandsons got a chance to watch some old movies ( Airplane,Police Academy) that they absolutely loved. We all had great laughs.Plenty of movies for little kids and and current ones also.would buy again ina heart beat.Made our evenings with s'mores and movies terrific.
customer_reviews.author: CBR

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Put side-by-side with my 9-year-old Epson, I’m still pleased. I would agree that, if you are wanting a projector for doing a PowerPoint presentation with text, there are better models out there if you have the funds. The clarity of a photo, video, or graph is fine, but text is not so crisp (see photos with Viewsonic on left and Epson on right). The brightness is surprisingly sufficient for a lighted room. The projector’s physical size is a bit large, but not ridiculous. Overall good projector for the low price.
customer_reviews.author: AJW828

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good hd projector
customer_reviews.text: Great product currently running on super eco mode to save lamp life. Operating on normal mode you only get 5,000 hours of life out of the lamp.. beware the speakers are terrible. you definitely need a secondary sound system... the Image are sharp the colors of vibrant and the projector produces a very bright image even in direct sunlight... Works well with a fire stick.. you can magnify the image or decrease the image to fit a small room...
customer_reviews.author: anthony f.

customer_reviews.title: Text is very blurry
customer_reviews.text: The brightness of this viewsonic projector in normal mode is REALLY bright, Eco and super eco would’ve been fine. The Problem is it kept going back to Normal brightness. Moreso my issue with it is clarity. Connecting a laptop to the projector via HDMI, projector 10ft away, all text is really blurry even after attempting to focus it. Sorry. Nope!
customer_reviews.author: Tilly

customer_reviews.title: Great for presentations
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace two other quality projectors that reached their end of life. This one works just as nice. I hook it up with HDMI for picture and sound, or just a standard VGA for presentations. I use projectors primarily for business presentations. It feels a little cheaply made (light plastic) but it performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kilhullen

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: Great projector! The picture is crystal clear. What is really nice is when you mount it an an angle above the screen, it has a function that allows you to compensate for the distortion. We are using it for a backyard theater for our family during COVID-19. I would highly recommend. I purchased the XGA for the little extra money. Makes for a great picture.
customer_reviews.author: Tarra M. Baker

customer_reviews.title: I WAS loving it... disappoint af now
customer_reviews.text: So I've had it a little over a month now and it's been pretty decent. I know I do want to upgrade in the future but this being my first ever projector, I was satisfied. I use this instead of a TV. I hook it up to my Mac and do homework, watch movies, everything. So, I'm really disappointed that yesterday the bulb blew. It's inconvenient, frustrating and just...disappointing. Great projector. Buy a bulb with it though or you'll be f'd like me.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Using this was a near-disaster
customer_reviews.text: Imagine that you're doing a presentation of the final report from a 9-month project in front of 85 people. This is the 2nd time you've used the viewsonic 3600. Halfway through you turn around and the screen is showing a "cannot find source input". A colleague jumps up and stalls while another colleague grabs our old projector and I hurriedly swap them. The old projector works fine the rest of the night. What could have been an utter disaster turned out OK. But only because of the quick work of my co-workers and NO THANKS TO VIEWSONIC. I've owned optoma, infocus, and benQ. Why did I even take the chance on a new brand? Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for outdoor movie/game nights
customer_reviews.text: I searched and searched for an outdoor projector for movie nights and Cub games. There were so many solidly rated $100 projectors but every review was “great ‘for the price’”. That made me nervous. We’ve used this 3 times now and I can’t imagine anything better (obviously there is...not sure I could tell though!). Photo is on a 16’ screen and it’s still super bright and crisp! (Sorry kids are behind screen playing)
customer_reviews.author: hayley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a projector for showing movies outside and this projector was a prefect choice. The description, pictures and information was so thorough that it made my choice easy. That and the excellent reviews. Set up was super easy and the color is amazing! Although the sound didn't give us what we wanted, but we had speakers we hooked up to the projector and it was great. Overall, I highly recommend this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picture MUCH smaller that other projectors. Check the size before ordering. Otherwise, great picture and projector
customer_reviews.text: Great projector. Only time will tell about the DLP. Every other DLP we've owned failed inside three years. Bought 4yr warranty just in case :) The size ratio to distance is much different on this projector. The picture, mounted in the exact same location as the other projector we used, is MUCH smaller. One would have to move the projector back a LOT to get equivalent size picture. But it is very bright and has a GREAT picture. NOTE: when you try to use the super eco mode, it will not stay set to that mode. After a few minutes, the projector makes the light very bright and switches back to normal mode.
customer_reviews.author: S&E-Guat

customer_reviews.title: awesome for the price.
customer_reviews.text: looks great! decent quality for the price. audio is horrible, connected to my laptop and used the bluetooth on the laptop to connect to a wireless speaker. no complaints other than the sound for the price, but i had no intention of using the internal speakers anyway. was able to fit it to a 120in screen. video is with lots of daylight coming in and the light is still bright enough.
customer_reviews.author: Lee & CJ

customer_reviews.title: WXGA is great for outdoor movie nights!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This works perfectly for outdoor movie nights on my inflatable 20' screen. The colors and brightness are great. The WXGA model is definitely the way to go. The resolution is fantastic. I am very pleased. I would have liked to have better functionality on the remote (like FWD, rewind, pause, etc) but not a huge deal. You'll want an external speaker if you're using it outside, but not a big deal at all. At $400 you'll be hard pressed to find a better image out of a projector.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easily connects to our laptop and external speakers
customer_reviews.text: I work with a local organization that conducts Vietnam War Veteran Commemoration Ceremonies. We travel through out the Colorado Springs area to recognize our large populace of veterans. The compactness and portability of this unit has been a lifesaver. We no longer need to scramble to locate a projector. Easily connects to our laptop and external speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outdoor viewing during quarantine
customer_reviews.text: We are really enjoying hosting outdoor viewing parties with proper social distancing. We’ve had kids nights as well as movies with more mature themes and everyone loves it. The picture is crystal clear and such high quality. We use our Amazon Firestick and it works great. We haven’t yet perfected our sound system but we are getting there
customer_reviews.author: Jacki in Highland

customer_reviews.title: Bulb Failure First Year
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a replacement to an older PJD5133 that was a solid performer and lasted 5+ years with no issues. I wanted something brighter and went with the PA503W which is a good unit. I'm happy with the picture quality and brightness. My issue is the bulb has failed on me with 210 total hours. Had to order a replacement which is not cheap and has me questioning the longevity and value of this investment. I ordered a premium bulb replacement so im hoping this will last several years.
customer_reviews.author: sva

customer_reviews.title: Great projector  - a crowd pleaser in our back yard :)
customer_reviews.text: we bought this for movies in the back garden. It works really well, picture is clear and well defined, both on a screen or a sheet. We started with the sheet and upgraded to a screen, the kids loved it so much. Sound was not good from this, but a set of appropriate speakers solves that problem. Very easy to use. Wish it came with a protective bag. I'm not at all technical and found this pretty intuitive to set this up and stream from our laptop. A winner for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Scottydog

customer_reviews.title: Will not invert unless 3D
customer_reviews.text: I just received it and I'm sending it back because it will NOT invert an image unless it is 3D. If you are going to ceiling mount this projector, you need to be doing 3D, which I do not have. Also, one of the answers to the questions says it tell you how on page 12, which is untrue.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Bright, easy to focus, high quality
customer_reviews.text: Tried two different LED projectors with higher raitings and announced 5000 Lux: returned them both and bought the same unit that we had for 3 years by ViewSonic (old one was damaged during a show, when prop liquid got into it). Amazing quality and brightness ! It is much brighter than 5000 LUX LEDs. Easy to focus . Unit is almost 14 feet from screen, fully covering 100". Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor movies!
customer_reviews.text: The projector is legit. The HDMI output is a must have.. You hook it up to any of your DVD players, and some kind of sound through whatever output in the DVD player, and you're good to go. I've only used it for outdoor movie applications, but am looking forward to trying it for office presentations too. Picture quality is amazing. The sound from the projector is nothing usable for an outdoor application, but it might be acceptable for a small office presentation that doesn't require quality audio.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bare

customer_reviews.title: Very bright and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Very bright and works great. I might even have learned my lesson that not all projectors are created equal. What I mean is that I was going for the lumens and forgot to check the picture dimensions at 10 ft. so although it was very bright it was also smaller so I had to move the mount back a few feet. Still a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality , Poor sync ability
customer_reviews.text: I give this product a for because the picture quality was great , even when there was a lot of light in the area. However the projector would only sync with an old laptop running on windows 7 and not with my new one. So I found this a bit annoying. Thankfully I was trying this out at home and not at an event. For this reason I may have to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A Webb

customer_reviews.title: Strong Crisp Projection for PPT
customer_reviews.text: This projector has worked well for me on two occasions so far. That is 2 out of 2 occasions. In the first case we were in a hotel meeting room with no outside windows and in the second situation we were in a room with a clear glass wall during the day time. Both times we had no problem seeing the presentation material. The projector itself is easy to set-up and easy to use. Since I bought the projector, i.e. it is my personal property, I also took the opportunity to set it up at home and watch some TV/movies on it. That too is quite good with no issues. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Tarver

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you plan to use AUX OUT for external speakers...
customer_reviews.text: The AUX OUT (for external speakers) does not function properly. To get it to work I need to manually disconnect and reconnect the aux cable every time the projector is powered off. Called ViewSonic and this appears to be a design flaw. Also odd that an earlier model that I used for 3 years didn't have this issue. Disappointing because the picture quality is good. Going to return and buy a projector with bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: dgon

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and choose WXGA instead of SVGA
customer_reviews.text: I first tried a projector around $100, whose image was super blurry. So I read many review articles and found this product. At the beginning, I chose the SVGA product since the title says it supports 1080p. HOWEVER, supporting 1080p doesn't mean the projected image is 1080p. Indeed, the image resolution for SVGA is 800*600. So I returned the SVGA and bought the WXGA version, whose resolution is 1280*800 and the number of pixels is twice of the SVGA version. Using the WXGA, the projected image is much sharper. I really like this product, and it is perfect for presentation, movie and online learning.
customer_reviews.author: Xiongyu Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in great shape and working order. Image is very bright and clear. Set up was a snap and I like the settings. This unit is not idea for movies or video games in a large room, but you would have to pay much, much more to get better resolution. For presentations and classroom lectures, this unit does the job. I am very happy and satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: MacGyver

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A GREAT DEAL!
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe the quality of picture along with the brightness of this projector for the price. I have had projectors in the living room since 1996, comparing this to the benQ projector it replaces is just no comparison at all. Crystal clear picture with beautiful color and deep contrast, all in an environment with more light than normal for such an installation.
customer_reviews.author: jill

customer_reviews.title: Pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with this purchase. Very clear picture even in a room that's not completely dark. Purchased this for our church. For missionary presentations and such. Pretty simple set up...it was easy-peasy to connect to laptop and play films or slideshows.
customer_reviews.author: VLILLY

customer_reviews.title: Great deal. Great picture. Day or night.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use in our covered outdoor patio area. As you can see in the photo, the image is well over 100”, very clear, and this is at the lowest light setting. In the daylight the picture is still good but looks much better with normal or dynamic light modes. Day or night, it looks great, and I’m very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Good projector at a good price
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used it for a couple of months in giving presentations once or twice a day and am very pleased with it. I would have liked it to have a greater ability to change the size of the image- there is very little difference between the maximum size and the minimum size so the only way to increase or decrease the image size is by moving the projector. I often present in brightly-lit rooms and it has enough power to give a good image even then.
customer_reviews.author: ZimLarry

customer_reviews.title: Good for movies but not for gaming
customer_reviews.text: If your planning to game or read stuff on this, I recommend just getting a tv. Other then that if your watch a movie or YouTube it’s great with my Apple TV. I only have mine at 80 inches and you can still see the pixel up close which isn’t so good for reading small fonts. It only has one HDMI so you’re going to have to buy a HDMI splitter if you plan on using multiple device on it. The sounds is okay but it’s better then nothing. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Tien Ho

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is XGA, so not native wide screen HS. I kind wish I had sprung the extra bucks for WXGA, but this does work well enough even not being native to that mode. It's main saving grace is that it is pretty bright, and can project pretty well even in moderate lighting. It is simple to use and autodetected signals without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit
customer_reviews.text: It is somewhat daunting to select a projector with all the choices out there. I believe you tend to get what you pay for. ViewSonic is a product that has been around for YEARS. So I felt reasonably comfortable purchasing this unit. I purchased the "best" unit, i.e., the 1080p. Very pleased with performance. Reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: Best upgrade ever.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I bought a $160 Chinese goodee brand projector. It has good resolution however it just was not bright enough to fully enjoy, even for a budget projector. Trust me, spend the extra money. The chinese brands do not advertise the correct lumens. Stick with name brand on this as the correct specs are not hyped up like the chinese brands.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good deal and works well on both Mac and PC
customer_reviews.author: Buford E.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is incredible
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how relieved I am that I picked this projector out of all the rest. I've been looking into getting a projector for several weeks and was frankly overwhelmed with the many many choices. This projector beats out anything else in this price range. The picture quality, though not native 1080p, is very very good. The colors are fantastic, the image is sharp, and it's super bright. Please forgive the quality of my phone's camera, it does not do the projector justice. The last few pictures are with the lights on.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Colour good, keystoning good, Bright in a dark room only. Don't buy for integrated speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gibney

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this projector for our church. I had ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this projector for our church. I had to return another cheaper version because the quality was very low. This project is so far working extremely well. The color and picture quality is very high. It is very user-friendly. The only thing I do not know how to use is some of the buttons on the remote control (page up and page down) . I tried to use it to advance my powerpoint files and it did not work. I looked on you tube and did not find any instruction videos. I am sure that we will use this device for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: robel yacob

customer_reviews.title: Solid Entry Level Projector
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good build quality; good size; very good picture and brightness. Controls and remote are easy to use. Cons: No discernible quality issues; input lacks Bluetooth capability. Volume should be a little louder. We’ve used indoors and outdoors in a canopy. I would not hesitate in recommending this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid 4 star projector. If it had a little sharper picture it would definitely be 5 stars. Unlike most TV's it has no "sharpness" adjustment so everything just looks a little fuzzy to me. That aside, the colors are really nice and when you're out under the stars the picture is plenty good for the vast majority of people (especially if it's kids on blankets eating popcorn). Watching movies while camping is a really cool nostalgic experience that always takes me back to my childhood, going to the drive-in.
customer_reviews.author: Ophiacus

customer_reviews.title: VERY happy with this projector
customer_reviews.text: This projector replaces a 15-year old, $1200 Canon. The projection quality of this one exceeds the old Canon. I use it for PowerPoint presentations to groups of 60 - 80, and the brightness and color are more than adequate. Controls to correct distortion are right on the control panel (they were buried in a menu maze on my old Canon). Highly recommend this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ellis

customer_reviews.title: So Happy
customer_reviews.text: We love this projector. It has great quality picture and we have it pointed directly on the wall. We basically get a 105 inch tv and we get complements all the time. We have had 2 different smart tv's die in less than a year and it was less to buy this than another tv. We will definitely purchase again when this projectors life is over. My camera quality isn't great so the picture I added isn't flattering in that way but it gives you an idea of the size.
customer_reviews.author: katie Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: Not a technical review. Its bright, its clear, good contrast, its an upgrade from an earlier version I had from the same company from years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon4543

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great Until It Didn't
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the product to use for a golf simulator. It worked very well in the limited time i was able to use. In the 18 months I had the product I used the product under 100 hours. Last month the lamp burned out. While the life expectancy is around 5,000 hours, the lamp is no longer covered under warranty so I have to purchase a new bulb. I know the bulb is no longer under warranty but the bulb should last more than 100 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Ben C

customer_reviews.title: ITS SO BRIGHT
customer_reviews.text: It's so freaking bright! It lacks a few features like left to right tilting but for the price its great. They did things to cut cost and focus on a better picture which is good. No one needs a great built in speaker and I like to use HDMI switches so 1 port doesn't bother me but the big thing I love is that the dust doesn't create dead looking pixels on the screen like most cheaper projectors yeah it gets hot. Look at how bright it is!
customer_reviews.author: billy ray simpson

customer_reviews.title: A Great Projector
customer_reviews.text: Wow, for the price this projector is outstanding. The picture quality is superb. I hooked it up upside down on my pergola around 10 to 12 feet away from a 100 inch screen and the picture looked great. I hooked up my Amazon Fire Stick to the projector and it worked great.The price was also right. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: scennimo

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: I don't know a lot about projectors, this is the first one I've owned or used BUT I've seen a couple others being used and the quality of pictures that were produced. I am so happy with this purchase. We are using this projector to watch movies outside in our back yard in the evenings. And the brightness of this projector is amazing. The quality of the picture is also amazing. We've only used it twice but both times it's work great. No problems. Easy set up, audio in/out. Others don't have the audio out capability. Over all COMPLETELY satisfied with this projector so far!!
customer_reviews.author: Capt.Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This projector is amazing. Picture quality is on point. I placed this in my living room and even with daylight picture is still bright. I give it only 4 stars because the I have to reset the audio out every single time the projector is turned on. I’ve tried different auxiliary cables and receivers and always the same thing. It’s the only issue I have with this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Lugo

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for our Office / Lectures / PowerPoints.
customer_reviews.text: Did lots of research on this and am happy with our choice. It has and will be used 95% for projecting PowerPoint's etc for classroom work. The colors are good, even in bright light and the resolution is just fine for our use. Haven't used the sound component yet, so ca't rate that. The only down side is the remote - we had trouble getting it to work for forward the PowerPoint,and the buttons are tiny, so I'd recommend getting a separate remote to control the laptop. We had to borrow one and it was much better and easier.
customer_reviews.author: ABBRA

customer_reviews.title: I love this product and glad I purchased this one and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and glad I purchased this one and returned the other projector I bought previously. This was a bit more pricey but way worth it. I enjoy watching Netflix, movies, and can hook up a Blu-ray DVD player just fine. The quality of the picture is so phenomenal. I would buy this product all over again. We use this more often than our 65" TV in the bedroom, lol!! and, it is a lot less expensive than buying a TV. I recommend to purchase with this is the Logitech speakers, Z533, 120W, works very well with this Home Theater Projector.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Super price better performance.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use installed on the Small Church for service presentation to much windows and day light, the proyector works perfectly the colors are brilliant even in sunlight for a 120" screen and 15:' from the screen I really loved and love the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tek & Kopy

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a nice projector without breaking the bank, and this guy really delivered. I've got it mounted in my garage, projecting from behind the screen which spans my garage door. Once the sun has set, it looks great! Very bright, very clear image. I got the WXGA, so i'm not sure how the others look, but this one looks great. Only cons would be that it only has 1 HDMI port, and the speaker is horrible, but I never intended to use the speaker in the first place. I highly recommend for outdoor movie nights.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Schwieterman

customer_reviews.title: Height and Width display options are MIA.
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have a big living room and want this display to fill a wall keep looking. Half the display options are grayed out and unavailable I have it hooked up to my Xbox one and is literally half the display size of my previous Epson. Immediately returning this POS.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: he had to admit it was a great choice! I was impressed with how easy it ...
customer_reviews.text: After much shopping around and my techie husband's help, I purchased this to show my PowerPoint presentations. My husband was unsure it would be able to do what I wanted, but after the first class, and the attendee's response, he had to admit it was a great choice! I was impressed with how easy it was to operate and the clear picture!! The lights were on and it was still clear! I highly recommend this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
